Name: Acceptance
Description: a person's assent to the reality of a situation, recognizing a process or condition (often a negative or uncomfortable situation) without attempting to change it or protest it.

Name: Affection
Description: a gentle feeling of fondness or liking.

Name: Amusement
Description: the state or experience of finding something funny.

Name: Anger
Description: a strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.

Name: Angst
Description: a feeling of deep anxiety or dread, typically an unfocused one about the human condition or the state of the world in general.

Name: Anguish
Description: severe mental or physical pain or suffering.

Name: Annoyance
Description: the feeling or state of being annoyed; irritation.

Name: Anticipation
Description: the action of anticipating something; expectation or prediction.

Name: Anxiety
Description: a feeling of worry, nervousness, or unease, typically about an imminent event or something with an uncertain outcome.

Name: Apathy
Description: lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern.

Name: Awe
Description: a feeling of reverential respect mixed with fear or wonder.

Name: Boredom
Description: feeling weary because one is unoccupied or lacks interest in one's current activity.

Name: Confidence
Description: the feeling or belief that one can rely on someone or something; firm trust.

Name: Contempt
Description: the feeling that a person or a thing is beneath consideration, worthless, or deserving scorn.

Name: Contentment
Description: a state of happiness and satisfaction.

Name: Courage
Description: the ability to do something that frightens one.

Name: Curiosity
Description: a strong desire to know or learn something.

Name: Depression
Description: feelings of severe despondency and dejection.

Name: Desire
Description: a strong feeling of wanting to have something or wishing for something to happen.

Name: Despair
Description: the complete loss or absence of hope.

Name: Disappointment
Description: sadness or displeasure caused by the nonfulfillment of one's hopes or expectations.

Name: Disgust
Description: a feeling of revulsion or strong disapproval aroused by something unpleasant or offensive.

Name: Distrust
Description: the feeling that someone or something cannot be relied upon.

Name: Ecstasy
Description: an overwhelming feeling of great happiness or joyful excitement.

Name: Embarrassment
Description: a feeling of self-consciousness, shame, or awkwardness.

Name: Empathy
Description: the ability to understand and share the feelings of another.

Name: Enthusiasm
Description: intense and eager enjoyment, interest, or approval.

Name: Envy
Description: a feeling of discontented or resentful longing aroused by someone else's possessions, qualities, or luck.

Name: Euphoria
Description: a feeling or state of intense excitement and happiness.

Name: Fear
Description: an unpleasant emotion caused by the belief that someone or something is dangerous, likely to cause pain, or a threat.

Name: Frustration
Description: the feeling of being upset or annoyed, especially because of inability to change or achieve something.

Name: Gratification
Description: pleasure, especially when gained from the satisfaction of a desire.

Name: Gratitude
Description: the quality of being thankful; readiness to show appreciation for and to return kindness.

Name: Greed
Description: intense and selfish desire for something, especially wealth, power, or food.

Name: Grief
Description: deep sorrow, especially that caused by someone's death.

Name: Guilt
Description: the fact of having committed a specified or implied offense or crime.

Name: Happiness
Description: the state of being happy.

Name: Hatred
Description: intense dislike or ill will.

Name: Hope
Description: a feeling of expectation and desire for a certain thing to happen.

Name: Horror
Description: an intense feeling of fear, shock, or disgust.

Name: Hostility
Description: hostile behavior; unfriendliness or opposition.

Name: Humiliation
Description: the action of humiliating someone or the state of being humiliated.

Name: Interest
Description: the state of wanting to know or learn about something or someone.

Name: Jealousy
Description: feeling or showing envy of someone or their achievements and advantages.

Name: Joy
Description: a feeling of great pleasure and happiness.

Name: Kindness
Description: the quality of being friendly, generous, and considerate.

Name: Loneliness
Description: sadness because one has no friends or company.

Name: Love
Description: an intense feeling of deep affection.

Name: Lust
Description: very strong sexual desire.

Name: Nostalgia
Description: a sentimental longing or wistful affection for the past, typically for a period or place with happy personal associations.

Name: Outrage
Description: an extremely strong reaction of anger, shock, or indignation.

Name: Panic
Description: sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety, often causing wildly unthinking behavior.

Name: Passion
Description: an intense desire or enthusiasm for something.

Name: Pity
Description: the feeling of sorrow and compassion caused by the suffering and misfortunes of others.

Name: Pleasure
Description: a feeling of happy satisfaction and enjoyment.

Name: Pride
Description: a feeling or deep pleasure or satisfaction derived from one's own achievements, the achievements of those with whom one is closely associated, or from qualities or possessions that are widely admired.

Name: Rage
Description: violent, uncontrollable anger.

Name: Regret
Description: feel sad, repentant, or disappointed over (something that has happened or been done, especially a loss or missed opportunity).

Name: Rejection
Description: the dismissing or refusing of a proposal, idea, etc.

Name: Remorse
Description: deep regret or guilt for a wrong committed.

Name: Resentment
Description: bitter indignation at having been treated unfairly.

Name: Sadness
Description: feeling or showing sorrow; unhappy.

Name: Self-confidence
Description: a feeling of trust in one's abilities, qualities, and judgment.

Name: Self-pity
Description: excessive, self-absorbed unhappiness over one's own troubles.

Name: Shame
Description: a painful feeling of humiliation or distress caused by the consciousness of wrong or foolish behavior.

Name: Shock
Description: a sudden upsetting or surprising event or experience.

Name: Shyness
Description: being reserved or having or showing nervousness or timidity in the company of other people.

Name: Social connection
Description: the experience of feeling close and connected to others.

Name: Sorrow
Description: a feeling of deep distress caused by loss, disappointment, or other misfortune suffered by oneself or others.

Name: Suffering
Description: the state of undergoing pain, distress, or hardship.

Name: Surprise
Description: an unexpected or astonishing event, fact, or thing.

Name: Trust
Description: firm belief in the reliability, truth, ability, or strength of someone or something.

Name: Wonder
Description: a feeling of surprise mingled with admiration, caused by something beautiful, unexpected, unfamiliar, or inexplicable.

Name: Worry
Description: give way to anxiety or unease; allow one's mind to dwell on difficulty or troubles.
